p: It is a challenge to establish whether these cases are primary psychotic (stress triggers in people genetically predisposed), or secondary psychosis (treatment related, delirium or metabolic disturbances). In our experience, the differences were related to length of the episode and clinical features: subacute onset of psychotic symptoms (less than one week) and quick recovery (maximum 2 weeks) on low antipsychotic doses. We observed that all patients presented with thoughts of reference, however only those with acute delirium suffered hallucinations.
